guidelines.title: Medicine Safety Guidelines
guidelines.point1: These medicines are for mild symptoms and short-term use only
guidelines.point2: Always read the medicine information carefully before use
guidelines.point3: Do not exceed the recommended dosage or duration
guidelines.point4: Consult a healthcare professional if symptoms persist or worsen

notice.title: Important Medical Notice
notice.description: The medicines shown here are available in our vending machine for common mild symptoms. This system is not a substitute for professional medical advice. For serious conditions, allergic reactions, or if symptoms persist, please seek immediate medical attention.

generalGuidelines.title: General Usage Guidelines
generalGuidelines.point1: Take as directed on the package or as advised by a healthcare professional
generalGuidelines.point2: Do not exceed the recommended dosage
generalGuidelines.point3: Store in a cool, dry place away from direct sunlight

detail.1: For adults and children over 12 years old.
detail.2: Take 3â€“4 capsules per dose, 3â€“4 times a day.
detail.3: Take this medicine at least 2 hours before or after other medications.
detail.5: You can stop taking the medicine if symptoms improve.
detail.6: Do not take this medicine at the same time as other medications.
detail.7: If diarrhea does not improve within 2â€“3 days after taking the medicine, consult a doctor.
detail.8: Who have gastrointestinal conditions should consult a pharmacist before use.
detail.9: Stools may have dark color after taking activated charcoal.
detail.10: For some cases, allergic reactions may occur, such as rash, itching, swelling, difficulty breathing, or severe dizziness.
detail.13: Weight 68 kg and above: Take 2 tablets.
detail.15: Do not exceed 4 doses per day.
detail.16: Do not use this medicine continuously for more than 5 days.
detail.17: Avoid using this medicine together with other medications.
detail.18: Patients with liver disease should consult a doctor before using.
detail.19: If an allergic reaction occurs, consult a doctor immediately.
detail.22: Can be taken before or after meals.
detail.23: Take 2 tablets per dose, 3 times daily.
detail.24: You can stop taking the medicine if symptoms improve.
detail.25: Patients with liver, kidney, glaucoma, or urinary tract conditions should consult a pharmacist before use.
detail.26: Pregnant or breastfeeding women should consult a pharmacist before use.
detail.27: Do not take continuously for more than 3 days.
detail.29: For some may have stomach discomfort.
detail.30: In case of allergy, symptoms may include dry mouth/throat, constipation, blurred vision, or palpitations.
detail.33: You can stop taking the medicine if symptoms improve.
detail.34: Do not take more than 3 doses per day.
detail.35: Those allergic to NSAIDs should consult a pharmacist before use.
detail.36: People with stomach or intestinal conditions should consult a pharmacist before use.
detail.37: Those with heart disease, kidney disease, or high blood pressure should consult a pharmacist before use.
detail.38: For some may have stomach irritation.
detail.39: If abdominal pain, nausea, vomiting, or palpitations occur, seek medical attention immediately.
detail.40: Clean the wound with saline solution or clean water.
detail.41: Dry the wound and clean around it with alcohol.
detail.43: Cover the wound with adhesive bandages.
detail.44: For external use only. Do not ingest.

medicineDescription.1: Activated Charcoal 260 mg is used to treat diarrhea, bloating, and to absorb toxins in the digestive system.
medicineDescription.2: Paracetamol 500 mg is used to reduce fever and relieve general pain such as headaches. Suitable for adults and children aged 12 years and above.
medicineDescription.3: Orphenadrine 35 mg and Paracetamol 450 mg are used to relieve muscle pain in areas such as the neck, legs, and back caused by muscle tension or spasms.
medicineDescription.4: Mefenamic Acid 500 mg is used to relieve menstrual pain and other moderate pain such as toothache.
medicineDescription.5: A basic small wound cleaning kit includes iodine, alcohol, and adhesive bandages.
